alert.note: Alert for Beckham; Blaine; Custer; Roger Mills; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 01 at 4:39PM CDT until June 01 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Blaine County in northwestern Oklahoma... Northeastern Beckham County in western Oklahoma... Custer County in western Oklahoma... Southeastern Roger Mills County in western Oklahoma... Northwestern Washita County in western Oklahoma... * Until 1000 PM CDT. * At 439 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen over much of the warning area the past 24 hours, especially just north and west of Clinton and Weatherford. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area through early this evening. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Elk City, Weatherford, Clinton, Thomas, Arapaho, Hammon, Custer City, Butler, Foss, Strong City, Foss Reservoir, Moorewood and Stafford. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 42 and 43...and between mile markers 52 and 85. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Beckham; Blaine; Custer; Roger Mills; Washita
